intro: Ervatamia corymbosa, commonly known as the common ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ervatamia corymbosa is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
